intro: Cyrtandra × subintegra, commonly known as the hybrid mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often in mountainous areas. It is a sterile hybrid resulting from the cross between Cyrtandra fruticosa and Cyrtandra hookeri. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and shaded landscapes.
